title: U.S. Moves to Ease Tariffs on Imported Steel, Aluminum From Japan
sub_head: Washington, Tokyo to start talks to address bilateral concerns over steel and aluminum issues
body:
WASHINGTONâ€”The Biden administration is moving to ease import tariffs on Japanese steel and aluminum, in the latest step by the White House to reset trade relations with allies.
The U.S. and Japan will begin talks to address bilateral concerns over steel and aluminum issues, including the tariffs imposed by the Trump administration, U.S. trade and commerce officials said in a joint statement Friday.
